intro: Diosma punctata, commonly known as the spotted diosma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
